name: Remittance Powerhouse
title: Top Receiver of Global Remittances
description: In 2023, India received a staggering $106.5 billion in net secondary income from abroad, showcasing its position as a leading recipient of global remittances.

name: Political Stability Challenge
title: Struggles with Political Stability
description: Despite having 9 sources reporting on political stability, India faces challenges with a standard error of 0.205 in 2023, indicating ongoing concerns about violence and terrorism.

name: Health Workforce Gap
title: Limited Community Health Workers
description: With only 0.581 community health workers per 1,000 people in 2016, India faces a significant gap in healthcare workforce availability.

name: Child Nutrition Crisis
title: High Prevalence of Child Wasting
description: In 2020, 18.7% of children under 5 in India were affected by wasting, with severe cases at 7.5%, highlighting a critical public health issue.

name: Income Inequality Spotlight
title: Low Income Share for the Poorest
description: In 2022, the lowest 10% of India's population held only 4.5% of the income, while the lowest 20% held 10.4%, underscoring income inequality challenges.

name: Cost-Effective Remittances
title: Lowest Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: India boasts the lowest average transaction cost for sending remittances at just 0.54% in 2023, making it highly cost-effective for global money transfers.
